result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Andrew Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $518 DOC Collect within 1st 6 months of release from jail.  If probation is revoked/discharged with outstanding financial obligations, civil judgment to enter. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect

timeConds.notes: w/Huber, may work outside Rock County

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert Andrew Johnson in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft pleads Guilty freely and voluntarily; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; Court orders: sentence withheld: 4 years Probation, Concurrent with 15CF771; 1 year RCJail w/Huber, may work outside Rock County; AODA, Costs DOC Collect within 1st 6 monhs of release from Jail; 119 days credit, if revoked.

Defendant Robert Andrew Johnson in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motions to be filed by 06-20-2015  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury selection scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Calendar call on May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Andrew Johnson in court in custody with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. REQUEST FOR SPEEDY TRIAL verbally; Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set.
